etymologies: mid 19th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin similis like + -ative

definitions: Specifically. Of a word, grammatical case, construction, etc.: denoting or expressing similarity or likeness.

notes.text: In English grammar sometimes used specifically to refer to compounds in which the first element denotes an object with which comparison is being made, as in apple-green ‘green like an apple’.

definitions: A similative word, grammatical case, construction, etc.
